content: to watch a talk i gave to knitting4peace on the inspiration for my designs and my brand new finger puppets click here 1 to just watch my fingerprint puppet section click here 2 these cheerful and diversity-friendly finger puppets were designed for knitting4peace 3 they are knit in the round on dpns with bobble boots and arms to save on fiddly sewing the girl s hair is attached by looping it around the head hole with a tapestry needle for both the adult and child sizes i recommend sock/fingering for slightly bigger puppets you could use sport or dk **permission** although these puppets were designed for knitting4peace you have my permission to use them in any way you wish but i do ask that you make a small donation of $5 dollars or more in exchange you can donate here 4 if $5 is not doable please consider this pattern a gift **these puppets would also be a great gift to a school classroom to remind children that all are welcome ** > **praise for fingerprint puppets** > > these are so cute and fun to make > elemenopeo 5 > > quick little knit gigiginny 6 > > i found the pattern very easy to > follow and a super fun knit i was > worried that it would be futzy but > the clever bobble feet and hands were > easy to do and ending up very neat > looking longmontkathy 7 > > they are so cute thank you natasha > for always designing such cute dolls > mirihi 1 https //youtu be/sgvmbaxx7fo si=2xovoilsahmvpwhs&t=285 2 https //youtu be/sgvmbaxx7fo si=luszwp9yg7vstmwj&t=2045 3 https //www ravelry com/groups/knitting4peace 4 https //www knitting4peace org/donate 5 https //www ravelry com/projects/elemenopeo/fingerprint-puppet 6 https //www ravelry com/projects/gigiginny/little-puppet 7 https //www ravelry com/projects/longmontkathy/finger-puppet
